title: Krystal opts for luxury on her next Canadian adventure
text:
Krystal opts for luxury on her next Canadian adventure 20th Jul 2015 12:00 AM Krystal Steele: "The luxury service is just a bonus!" Photo: Flight Centre Related Items Local Real Estate Cars For Sale 
Having driven from one side of Canada to the other, it's safe to say travel consultant Krystal Steele from Flight Centre Whitsundays has seen her fair share of the country. Though she plans on doing things a little differently next time. 
"My first trip wasn't exactly glamorous; it was just four girlfriends and I in a beaten up, old van, but I fell in love with the Rockies and have been dying to get back ever since. On my next trip, I'll be swapping the van for a seat in GoldLeaf on board the Rocky Mountaineer train . 
"You're constantly looking up when you travel along the Icefields Park so it makes sense to see the stunning alpine landscape unfold before your eyes within their glass-dome train carriage. The luxury service is just a bonus!" 
The journey is particularly popular with her customers, and she's found that many aren't waiting until later in life to embark on these ultimate journeys. 
"Canada and Alaska are not as expensive as many people initially think. Many of my clients aren't waiting until their older years to travel. You never really know what's around the corner so you've got to see the world while you can." 
Her next dream holidays include an African safari with her young family, as well as the ultimate South American adventure - trekking the Inca Trail to Machu Picchu .
